BspDependency.Name: Drive_VBUS_HS
BspDependency.Comment: The GPIO is capable to drive the Pump charge of the VBUS

BspDependency.Name: Drive_VBUS_HS
BspDependency.Comment: The I2C is capable to drive the Pump charge of the VBUS

BspDependency.Name: Drive_VBUS_FS
BspDependency.Comment: The GPIO is capable to drive the Pump charge of the VBUS

BspDependency.Name: Drive_VBUS_FS
BspDependency.Comment: The I2C is capable to drive the Pump charge of the VBUS

Mode.Name: Host_Class_HS

Middleware:USBX:Host CoreStack HS

Middleware:NetXDuo:NX Core

Middleware:USBX:Host CoreStack HS
Middleware:USBX:Network Driver
Active only when USB_OTG_HS IP is configured in host mode or DRD mode

RefParameter.Name: UX_TRACE_INSERT_MACROS
RefParameter.Description: Determine if tracing is enabled.

Condition.Diagnostic: Active only when TX_ENABLE_EVENT_TRACE is enabled

RefParameter.Name: UX_TRACE_INSERT_MACROS
RefParameter.Description: Determine if tracing is enabled.

Condition.Diagnostic: Active only when TX_ENABLE_EVENT_TRACE is enabled

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_BIDIRECTIONAL_ENDPOINT_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description: Enable device bi-directional endpoint support.

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_CLASS_CDC_ACM_TRANSMISSION_DISABLE
RefParameter.Description: disable CDC ACM non-blocking transmission support.

RefParameter.Name: UX_THREAD_STACK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This value is the size of the stack in bytes for the USBX threads.It can be typically 1024 or 2048 bytes depending on the processor used and the host controller.�

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: UX_THREAD_STACK_SIZE must be greater than TX_MINIMUM_STACK

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_ENUM_THREAD_STACK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Define USBX Host Enum Thread Stack Size

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: UX_HOST_ENUM_THREAD_STACK_SIZE must be less than UX_THREAD_STACK_SIZE AND greater than TX_MINIMUM_STACK

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_HCD_THREAD_STACK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Define USBX Host Thread Stack Size

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: UX_HOST_HCD_THREAD_STACK_SIZE must be less than UX_THREAD_STACK_SIZE AND greater than TX_MINIMUM_STACK

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_HID_REPORT_TRANSFER_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: Define HID report transfer timeout value in millisecond. The default is 10000 milliseconds.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_HNP_POLLING_THREAD_STACK
RefParameter.Description: Define USBX Host HNP Polling Thread Stack Size

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: UX_HOST_HNP_POLLING_THREAD_STACK must be less than UX_THREAD_STACK_SIZE AND greater than TX_MINIMUM_STACK

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_HCD
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the number of different host controllers available in the system. For USB 1.1 support, this value will usually be 1. For USB 2.0 support, this value can be more than 1. This value represents the number of concurrent host controllers running at the same time. If for instance there are two instances of OHCI running, or one EHCI and one OHCI controller running, the UX_MAX_HCD should be set to 2

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_HOST_LUN
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the maximum number of SCSI logical units represented in the host storage class driver

RefParameter.Name: UX_PERIODIC_RATE
RefParameter.Description: This value represents how many ticks per seconds for a specific hardware platform.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_STORAGE_MEMORY_BUFFER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the maximum number of bytes that a storage payload can send/receive.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_STORAGE_THREAD_STACK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: USBX Mass Storage Thread Stack Size

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: UX_HOST_CLASS_STORAGE_THREAD_STACK_SIZE must be less than UX_THREAD_STACK_SIZE AND greater than TX_MINIMUM_STACK

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_ED
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the maximum number of EDs in the controller pool. This number is assigned to one controller only. If multiple instances of controllers are present, this value is used by each individual controller

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_TD
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the maximum number of regular and isochronous TDs in the controller pool. This number is assigned to one controller only. If multiple instances of controllers are present, this value is used by each individual controller

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_ISO_TD
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the maximum number of regular and isochronous TDs in the controller pool. This number is assigned to one controller only. If multiple instances of controllers are present, this value is used by each individual controller

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_HID_DECOMPRESSION_BUFFER
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the maximum size of the HID decompressed buffer. This cannot be determined in advance so we allocate a big block, usually 4K but for simple HID devices like keyboard and mouse it can be reduced a lot

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_HID_USAGES
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the maximum number of HID usages for a HID device

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_HID_KEYBOARD_EVENTS_KEY_CHANGES_MODE
RefParameter.Description: If defined, this value causes ux_host_class_hid_keyboard_key_get to only report key changes i.e. key presses and key releases. By default, it only reports when a key is down.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_HID_KEYBOARD_EVENTS_KEY_CHANGES_MODE_REPORT_KEY_DOWN_ONLY
RefParameter.Description: This value causes ux_host_class_hid_keyboard_key_get to only report key changes i.e. key presses and key releases. By default, it only reports when a key is down.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_HID_KEYBOARD_EVENTS_KEY_CHANGES_MODE_REPORT_LOCK_KEYS
RefParameter.Description: This value causes ux_host_class_hid_keyboard_key_get to report lock key (CapsLock/NumLock/ScrollLock) changes.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_HID_KEYBOARD_EVENTS_KEY_CHANGES_MODE_REPORT_MODIFIER_KEYS
RefParameter.Description: This value causes ux_host_class_hid_keyboard_key_get to report modifier key (Ctrl/Alt/Shift/GUI) changes.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_STORAGE_MAX_MEDIA
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the maximum number of media for the host storage class.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_STORAGE_INCLUDE_LEGACY_PROTOCOL_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description: This value includes code to handle storage devices that use the CB or CBI protocol (such as floppy disks).

RefParameter.Name: UX_ENFORCE_SAFE_ALIGNMENT
RefParameter.Description: This value forces the memory allocation scheme to enforce alignement of memory with the UX_SAFE_ALIGN field.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_CDC_ECM_NX_PKPOOL_ENTRIES
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the number of packets in the CDC_ECM host class.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_CDC_ECM_PACKET_POOL_INSTANCE_WAIT
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the number of milliseconds to wait for packet instance allocation until invoking the application's error callback and retrying.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_CDC_ECM_USE_PACKET_POOL_FROM_NETX
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this enables CDC ECM class to use the packet pool from NetX instance.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_CDC_ECM_PACKET_POOL_WAIT
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the number of milliseconds to wait for packet allocation until invoking the application's error callback and retrying.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_SIDE_ONLY
RefParameter.Description: This value will only enable the host side of usbx.

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_STORAGE_MAX_TRANSFER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the maximum size of single tansfers for the SCSI data phase.

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEBUG_LOG_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the size of the log pool.

RefParameter.Name: UX_THREAD_PRIORITY_ENUM
RefParameter.Description: This is the ThreadX priority value for the USBX enumeration threads that monitors the bus topology

RefParameter.Name: UX_THREAD_PRIORITY_CLASS
RefParameter.Description: This is the ThreadX priority value for the standard USBX threads

RefParameter.Name: UX_THREAD_PRIORITY_HCD
RefParameter.Description: This is the ThreadX priority value for the host controller thread.

RefParameter.Name: UX_NO_TIME_SLICE
RefParameter.Description: This value actually defines the time slice that will be used for threads. For example, if defined to 0, the ThreadX target port does not use time slices.

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_SLAVE_CLASS_DRIVER
RefParameter.Description: This value is the maximum number of classes in the device stack that can be loaded by USBX

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_SLAVE_INTERFACES
RefParameter.Description: This value is the maximum number of interfaces in the device framework

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_DEVICES
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the maximum number of devices that can be attached to the USB. Normally, the theoretical maximum number on a single USB is 127 devices. This value can be scaled down to conserve memory. Note that this value represents the total number of devices regardless of the number of USB buses in the system.

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_SLAVE_LUN
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the current number of SCSI logical units represented in the device storage class driver.

RefParameter.Name: UX_SLAVE_REQUEST_CONTROL_MAX_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the maximum number of bytes received on a control endpoint in the device stack

RefParameter.Name: UX_SLAVE_REQUEST_DATA_MAX_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the maximum number of bytes that can be received or transmitted on any endpoint. This value cannot be less than the maximum packet size of any endpoint.

RefParameter.Name: UX_SLAVE_CLASS_STORAGE_INCLUDE_MMC
RefParameter.Description: this value includes code to handle storage Multi-Media Commands (MMC). E.g., DVD-ROM.

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_CLASS_CDC_ECM_NX_PKPOOL_ENTRIES
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the number of packets in the CDC_ECM device class.

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_CLASS_CDC_ECM_PACKET_POOL_WAIT
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the number of milliseconds to wait for packet allocation until invoking the application's error callback and retrying

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_CLASS_HID_EVENT_BUFFER_LENGTH
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the the maximum length of HID reports on the device.

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_CLASS_HID_MAX_EVENTS_QUEUE
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the the maximum number of HID events/reports that can be queued at once.

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_SIDE_ONLY
RefParameter.Description: This value will only enable the device side of usbx

RefParameter.Name: UX_THREAD_PRIORITY_DCD
RefParameter.Description: This is the ThreadX priority value for the device controller thread.

RefParameter.Name: UX_OTG_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description: this value will include the OTG polling thread. OTG can only be active if both host/device are present.

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_CLASS_DRIVER
RefParameter.Description: This value is the maximum number of classes that can be loaded by USBX. This value represents the class container and not the number of instances of a class.

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_DEVICE_ENDPOINTS
RefParameter.Description:
It defines USBX device max number of endpoints (1~n).
It must be greater or equal than the numbre of endpoints used.

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_DEVICE_INTERFACES
RefParameter.Description: it define USBX device max number of interfacess (1~n).

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_ROOTHUB_PORT
RefParameter.Description: Define USBX max root hub port (1 ~ n).

RefParameter.Name: UX_MAX_TT
RefParameter.Description: Define USBX max TT.

RefParameter.Name: USBX_Version
RefParameter.Description: USBX version

RefParameter.Description: this the device storage endpoint in address, <font color="red">make sure to have a unique address for the same class and alongside other device classes.</font>

RefParameter.Name: USBD_MSC_EPOUT_FS_MPS
RefParameter.Description: Device storage class endpoint out_FS Max Packet Size

RefParameter.Name: USBD_DFU_XFER_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Maximum number of bytes that the device can accept per control-write operation. Note : The value of UX_SLAVE_REQUEST_CONTROL_MAX_LENGTH shall be greater or equal to USBD_DFU_XFER_SIZE

RefParameter.Name: USBD_DFU_MEDIA
RefParameter.Description: USBD_DFU_MEDIA Parameter Description: The description of the flash (used by PC tool DFuSe) Each Alternate setting string descriptor must follow this memory mapping so that the PC Host Software can decode the right mapping for the selected device: ● @: To detect that this is a special mapping descriptor (to avoid decoding standard descriptor) ● /: for separator between zones ● Maximum 8 digits per address starting by “0x” ● /: for separator between zones ● Maximum of 2 digits for the number of sectors ● *: For separator between number of sectors and sector size ● Maximum 3 digits for sector size between 0 and 999 ● 1 digit for the sector size multiplier. Valid entries are: B (byte), K (Kilo), M (Mega) ● 1 digit for the sector type as follows: – a (0x41): Readable – b (0x42): Erasable – c (0x43): Readable and Erasabled - d(0x44): Writeable – e (0x45): Readable and Writeable – f (0x46): Erasable and Writeable – g (0x47): Readable, Erasable and Writeable Note: If the target memory is not contiguous, the user can add the new sectors to be decoded just after a slash"/" as shown in the following example: "@Flash /0xF000/1*4Ka/0xE000/1*4Kg/0x8000/2*24Kg"

RefParameter.Name: USBD_DFU_DetachTimeout
RefParameter.Description: Time, in milliseconds, that the device will wait after receipt of the DFU_DETACH request. If this time elapses without a USB reset, then the device will terminate the Reconfiguration phase and revert back to normal operation. This represents the maximum time that the device can wait (depending on its timers, etc.).

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_CLASS_DFU_STATUS_POLLTIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: This value represents the default DFU status bwPollTimeout. The value is 3 bytes long (max 0xFFFFFFu). By default the bwPollTimeout is 1 (means 1ms)

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_CLASS_DFU_CUSTOM_REQUEST_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: This macro will enable custom request process callback

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_CLASS_DFU_ERROR_GET_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: This macro will enable DFU_GETSTATUS and DFU_GETSTATE in dfu ERROR

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_CLASS_DFU_UPLOAD_DISABLE
RefParameter.Description: This macro disable DFU Upload support

RefParameter.Name: USBD_DFU_BM_ATTRIBUTES
RefParameter.Description: Bit 3: device will perform a bus detach-attach sequence when it receives a DFU_DETACH request. The host must not issue a USB Reset. (bitWillDetach) 0 = no 1 = yes Bit 2: device is able to communicate via USB after Manifestation phase. (bitManifestationTolerant) 0 = no, must see bus reset 1 = yes Bit 1: upload capable (bitCanUpload) 0 = no 1 = yes Bit 0: download capable (bitCanDnload) 0 = no 1 = yes

RefParameter.Name: MEDIA_ERASE_TIME
RefParameter.Description: Time to erase media 1 (means 1ms)

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_CLASS_DFU_STATUS_MODE
RefParameter.Description: simple mode enabled: status is queried from application in dfuDNLOAD-SYNC and dfuMANIFEST-SYNC state, (no bwPollTimeout.) simple mode disabled: status is queried from application once requested, (bwPollTimeout supported)

RefParameter.Name: MEDIA_PROGRAM_TIME
RefParameter.Description: time to media prgram 1 (means 1ms)

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_CLASS_AUDIO_FEEDBACK_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description: Enable the device audio Feedback support

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_CLASS_AUDIO_INTERRUPT_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description: Enable the device audio interrupt endpoint support

RefParameter.Name: UX_DEVICE_CLASS_CDC_ACM_WRITE_AUTO_ZLP
RefParameter.Description: Enable automatic pending ZLP (complete transfer) after buffer is sent

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_DEVICE_CLASS_CODE_VALIDATION_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: Enables host device class code validation

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_HID_INTERRUPT_OUT_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description: Add support for Host HID OUT interrupt

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_AUDIO_2_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description: Enable the host audio UAC 2.0 supported

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_AUDIO_FEEDBACK_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description: Enable the host audio Feedback support

RefParameter.Name: UX_HOST_CLASS_AUDIO_INTERRUPT_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description: Enable the host audio interrupt endpoint support

RefParameter.Name: UX_PIMA_WITH_MTP_SUPPORT
RefParameter.Description: Enables device/host PIMA MTP support

RefParameter.Name: USBX_HOST_MEM_POOL_VAR_NAME
RefParameter.Description:
Default USBX Host memory pool var name
This is a variable name. It should be C compliant declaration, Otherwise compilation errors will be generated in the project.

RefParameter.Name: USBX_DEVICE_MEM_POOL_VAR_NAME
RefParameter.Description:
Default USBX Device memory pool var name
This is a variable name. It should be C compliant declaration, Otherwise compilation errors will be generated in the project.

RefParameter.Description: The Product Identfier value present on the Device Descriptor

RefParameter.Comment: USBX Device Generate Core Init code
RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_DEVICE_CORE
RefParameter.Description: Generate USBX Device Core Init code.

RefParameter.Name: USBX_DEVICE_SYS_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: default Size of the regular memory pool for USBX stack must be less than the memory pool size. Required value: - HID class : 4*1024 - Storage class : 5*1024 - DFU class: 4*1024 - CDC ACM class: 6*1024 - CDC ECM class: 34*1024 - VIDEO class: 6*1024 - RNDIS class: 34*1024 - MTP class: 12*1024 - Printer Class:3*1024 - CCID Class:8*1024 - Composite : addition of class required memory.

RefParameter.Name: REG_USBX_DEVICE_CON_CK
RefParameter.Description: Register USBX Device Connection Callback invoked when: - USB Device Connected. - USB Device Disconnected. - USB SOF Received. - USB Device Suspended. - USB Device Resumed. - USB Device Removed. - USB Device Attached.

RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_DEVICE_THREAD
RefParameter.Description: Generate usbx device app thread

RefParameter.Name: USBX_DEVICE_APP_THREAD_NAME
RefParameter.Description: Main thread entry function Name. should not be empty

RefParameter.Name: USBX_DEVICE_APP_THREAD_PRIO
RefParameter.Description: ThreadX Application Thread Priority must be between 0 and TX_MAX_PRIORITIES.

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: The value of USBX Device Application Thread priority must be less than TX_MAX_PRIORITIES

RefParameter.Comment: USBX Device Application Thread Stack Size
RefParameter.Name: USBX_DEVICE_APP_THREAD_Size
RefParameter.Description: Thread stack size must be between 512 and UXDevice memory pool size.

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: The value of USBX Device Application Thread Stack Size must be less or equal than UX_DEVICE_APP_MEM_POOL_SIZE

RefParameter.Comment: Register USBX Device Class HID MOUSE
RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_DEVICE_HID_MOUSE
RefParameter.Description: Generate USBX Device Class HID Mouse init parameters.

RefParameter.Comment: Register USBX Device Class HID KEYBOARD
RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_DEVICE_HID_KEYBOARD
RefParameter.Description: Generate USBX Device Class HID Keyboard init parameters.

RefParameter.Comment: Register USBX Device Class HID CUSTOM
RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_DEVICE_HID_CUSTOM
RefParameter.Description: Generate USBX Device Class HID Custom init parameters.

RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_DEVICE_STORAGE
RefParameter.Description: Generate USBX Device Class Storage init parameters.

RefParameter.Comment: Register USBX Device Class CDC ACM
RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_DEVICE_CDC_ACM
RefParameter.Description: Generate USBX Device Class CDC ACM init parameters.

RefParameter.Comment: Register USBX Device Class CDC ECM
RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_DEVICE_CDC_ECM
RefParameter.Description: Generate USBX Device Class CDC ECM init parameters.

RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_DEVICE_DFU
RefParameter.Description: Generate USBX Device Class DFU init parameters.

RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_DEVICE_RNDIS
RefParameter.Description: Generate USBX Device Class RNDIS init parameters.

RefParameter.Comment: Register USBX Device Class PIMA MTP
RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_DEVICE_PIMA_MTP
RefParameter.Description: Generate USBX Device Class PIMA init parameters.

RefParameter.Comment: USBX Host Generate Core Init code
RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_HOST_CORE
RefParameter.Description: Generate USBX Host Core Init code for the USBX Host application.

RefParameter.Name: USBX_HOST_SYS_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Default pool size for USBX stack. Required value: - HID class : 18*1024 - Storage class : 22*1024 - CDC ACM class: 10*1024

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: The value of USBX Host System Stack Size must be less than USBX Host memory pool size

RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_HOST_THREAD
RefParameter.Description: Generate usbx Host app thread

RefParameter.Name: USBX_HOST_APP_THREAD_NAME
RefParameter.Description: Main thread entry function Name. should not be empty

RefParameter.Comment: USBX Host Application thread stack size
RefParameter.Name: USBX_HOST_APP_THREAD_Size
RefParameter.Description: Size stack of the applicative USBX Host thread.

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: The value of USBX Host Application thread stack size must be less than USBX Host memory pool size

RefParameter.Name: USBX_HOST_APP_THREAD_PRIO
RefParameter.Description: ThreadX Application Thread Priority must be between 0 and TX_MAX_PRIORITIES.

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: The value of USBX Host Application Thread priority must be less than TX_MAX_PRIORITIES

RefParameter.Comment: Register USBX Host Class HID MOUSE
RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_HOST_HID_MOUSE
RefParameter.Description: Register USBX Host Class HID MOUSE

RefParameter.Comment: Register USBX Host Class HID KEYBOARD
RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_HOST_HID_KEYBOARD
RefParameter.Description: Register USBX Host Class HID KEYBOARD

RefParameter.Comment: Register USBX Host Class CDC ACM
RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_HOST_CDC_ACM
RefParameter.Description: Register USBX Host Class CDC ACM

RefParameter.Comment: Register USBX Host Class Mass Storage
RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_HOST_Mass_Storage
RefParameter.Description: Register USBX Host Class Mass Storage

RefParameter.Comment: Register USBX Host Class HID RCU
RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_HOST_HID_RCU
RefParameter.Description: Register USBX Host Class HID RCU.

RefParameter.Name: UX_CONTROL_TRANSFER_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: Define control transfer timeout value in millisecond. The default is 10000 milliseconds.

RefParameter.Name: UX_NON_CONTROL_TRANSFER_TIMEOUT
RefParameter.Description: Define non control transfer timeout value in millisecond. The default is 50000 milliseconds.

RefParameter.Name: UX_ENABLE_ASSERT
RefParameter.Description: Defined, this enables the assert checks inside usbx.

RefParameter.Name: REG_UX_HOST_HUB
RefParameter.Description: Register USBX Host Class HUB
